page.title: 10Nether Stowey:Road Travel
page.content: Situated along the A39 the main road used to pass through the village. This was the old toll road, properly paved in the 19th century. The old toll house still stands in St. Mary's St., and just along the road are the two coaching inns - The George and The Rose and Crown. A new Nether Stowey by-pass was opened in 1970. The main form of transport in this country area is the private car. There are bus services run by the Southern National Bus Company. Buses run on the Bridgwater - Nether Stowey route at about two-hourly intervals on weekdays, the last bus leaving Bridgwater at 5.40pm. One bus calls on Sunday. The return adult fare is Â£1.80. Coaches provide a service for the schools. From this area there are well surfaced roads to Taunton, Bridgwater, and Minehead.
